title: Closest match to this book cover c. 1936 - script and slab
content:
Hi, typophiles,

Can anyone identify something close to either of these two typefaces on this book cover? (Jan Huizinga, In the Shadow of Tomorrow, 1936)?

I realize it's hand-lettered, but anything close as a starting place would be a big help - with some attention to the detail/peculiarities, if possible.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818002629im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Huizinga_6479.jpg)
author: deadchildstar

comments.content: Something within an "R" of the second is [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Constructa/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818002629/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Constructa/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Constructa/").

kinda weird and not really a script, but [Crestwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818002629/http:/www.fonts.com/font/ascender/crestwood/regular) has a similar feel and if you invert the S and f they are even more alike to your sample. odd.
Nice work spotting both Crestwood and Constructa... thanks - any other ideas on the script-face, especially, are appreciated.

The letterforms of the script show some similarities with Trafton Script, which was designed in 1933. [Pacific Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818002629/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scholtz/pacific-script/) is a revival of it.
